page.title: 07MAYDAY IN DALWOOD
page.content: On a day in May each year, children from Dalwood School dance around the maypole as part of Dalwood Fair celebrations. The pole is decorated with red, green and yellow ribbons. When the children dance around the pole, special patterns are made. The junior dances are the Gypsies Tent,Plaiting, the Barber's Pole and the Spider's Web. The Infants make up a dance of their own. The dancing takes place outside the village inn, the Tuckers' Arms. The children are led in by Jack o'the Green, a local man dressed in green leaves. The music is played by Mr Tony Drew on his accordian. After the dancing there are stalls and amusements, and teas are served by the W.I in the village Hall. The money raised goes towards the Fair Week in August.
